document.docTitle: Heteropoda aemulans Bayer & Jäger, 2009, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Heteropoda species from limestone caves in Laos (Araneae: Sparassidae: Heteropodinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Heteropoda species from limestone caves in Laos (Araneae: Sparassidae: Heteropodinae)

Note: Juveniles could be readily identified by their size and colouration.

Etymology. The specific name refers to the similarity of the present species with
Heteropoda maxima
(Latin “aemulare”, meaning “to emulate”); present participle active, term in apposition.

Prosoma length 7.7, prosoma width 6.3, anterior width of prosoma 3.2, opisthosoma length 6.7, opisthosoma width 3.6. Eyes: AME 0.33, ALE 0.64, PME 0.46, PLE 0.67, AME – AME 0.11, AME – ALE 0.03, PME – PME 0.21, PME – PLE 0.35, AME – PME 0.42, ALE – PLE 0.44, clypeus height at AME 0.62, clypeus height at ALE 0.42. Eyes not reduced in size ( Fig. 117 ).
Cheliceral furrow with denticles situated close to three promarginal teeth ( Fig. 58 ), retrolateral margin with 4 teeth. Trilobate membrane as in Fig. 54 .

Colouration. Generally lighter greyish-brown to yellowish-brown with darker brown pattern on opisthosoma, darker brown annulate patches on the legs, and darker brown transversal band basally on prosoma with radial patches on remaining part. Annulate patches on the legs more or less equal in length and in colour ( ♀ , Fig. 116 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 51–64.
Heteropoda aemulans
sp. nov.
from Vang Vieng area, Vientiane (51–56, 58 ♂ holotype, PJ 2332; 57 ♀ paratype, PJ 2780; 59 ♀ paratype, PJ 2335; 60–64 ♀ paratype, PJ 2781). 51–53 Left ♂ palp (51 prolateral, 52 ventral, 53 retrolateral); 54 Trilobate membrane of left fourth leg, inclined dorsal; 55 RTA, ventral; 56 Bulb, ventral; 57–58 Right chelicera, ventral; 59 Right ♀ palpal claw, prolateral; 60 Anterior part of internal duct system, frontal; 61 Vulva, dorsal; 62 Schematic course of internal duct system; 63–64 Epigyne (63 posterior, 64 ventral).

FIGURES 65–72.
Heteropoda aemulans
sp. nov.
from Vang Vieng area, Vientiane, variation of ♀ copulatory organ (65, 70 PJ 2783; 66, 71 PJ 2371; 67–68, 72 PJ 2335; 69 PJ 2385). 65–69 Epigyne (65–66, 68–69 ventral, 67 posterior); 70–72 Vulva, dorsal.

subSubSection.paragraph: Prosoma length 8.5 – 14.5, prosoma width 7.2 – 12.0, anterior width of prosoma 3.9 – 6.6, opisthosoma length 10.7 – 21.1, opisthosoma width 6.5 – 13.3. Eyes: AME 0.32 – 0.47, ALE 0.66 – 0.86, PME 0.51 – 0.71, PLE 0.68 – 0.90, AME – AME 0.18 – 0.31, AME – ALE 0.07 – 0.18, PME – PME 0.28 – 0.47, PME – PLE 0.53 – 0.81, AME – PME 0.46 – 0.67, ALE – PLE 0.57 – 0.73, clypeus height at AME 0.96 – 1.73, clypeus height at ALE 0.67 – 1.32.
